t: Mark 9
Then*p he said to them, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r there*r are*r some*r standing*r here*r who*r will*r not*r taste*r death*r until*r they*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r come*r in*r power.”*r
The Transfiguration
After*p six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John and led them up a high mountain by themselves to be alone. He was transfigured in front of them,
and his clothes became dazzling - extremely white as no launderer on earth could whiten them.
Elijah appeared to them with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it’s good for us to be here. Let’s set up three shelters: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah” -
because he did not know what to say, since they were terrified.
A*p cloud appeared, overshadowing them, and a voice came from the cloud: “This is my beloved Son; listen to him!”
Suddenly,*p looking around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus.
As*p they were coming down the mountain, he ordered them to tell no one what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
They kept this word to themselves, questioning what “rising from the dead” meant.
Then*p they asked him, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

“Elijah*rp does*r come*r first*r and*r restores*r all*r things,”*r he replied. “Why*r then*r is*r it*r written*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r must*r suffer*r many*r things*r and*r be*r treated*r with*r contempt?*r
But*r I*r tell*r you*r that*r Elijah*r has*r come,*r and*r they*r did*r whatever*r they*r pleased*r to*r him,*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r about*r him.”*r
The Power of Faith over a Demon
When*p they came to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and scribes disputing with them.
When the whole crowd saw him, they were amazed and ran to greet him.
He asked them, “What*r are*r you*r arguing*r with*r them*r about?”*r
Someone*p from the crowd answered him, “Teacher, I brought my son to you. He has a spirit that makes him unable to speak.
Whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive it out, but they couldn’t.”
He*p replied to them, “You*r unbelieving*r generation,*r how*r long*r will*r I*r be*r with*r you?*r How*r long*r must*r I*r put*r up*r with*r you?*r Bring*r him*r to*r me.”*r
So they brought the boy to him. When the spirit saw him, it immediately threw the boy into convulsions. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.
“How*r long*r has*r this*r been*r happening*r to*r him?”*r Jesus asked his father. “From*p childhood,” he said.
“And many times it has thrown him into fire or water to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
Jesus*p said to him, “‘If*r you*r can’?*r Everything*r is*r possible*r for*r the*r one*r who*r believes.”*r
Immediately*p the father of the boy cried out, “I do believe; help my unbelief!”

When*p Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “You*r mute*r and*r deaf*r spirit,*r I*r command*r you:*r Come*r out*r of*r him*r and*r never*r enter*r him*r again.”*r
Then*p it came out, shrieking and throwing him into terrible convulsions. The boy became like a corpse, so that many said, “He’s dead.”
But Jesus, taking him by the hand, raised him, and he stood up.
After*p he had gone into the house, his disciples asked him privately, “Why couldn’t we drive it out?”
And*p he told them, “This*r kind*r can*r come*r out*r by*r nothing*r but*r prayer.”*r
The Second Prediction of His Death
Then*p they left that place and made their way through Galilee, but he did not want anyone to know it.

For he was teaching his disciples and telling them, “The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r going*r to*r be*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men.*r They*r will*r kill*r him,*r and*r after*r he*r is*r killed,*r he*r will*r rise*r three*r days*r later.”*r
But they did not understand this statement, and they were afraid to ask him.
Who Is the Greatest?
They*p came to Capernaum. When he was in the house, he asked them, “What*r were*r you*r arguing*r about*r on*r the*r way?”*r
But they were silent, because on the way they had been arguing with one another about who was the greatest.
Sitting down, he called the Twelve and said to them, “If*r anyone*r wants*r to*r be*r first,*r he*r must*r be*r last*r and*r servant*r of*r all.”*r
He took a child, had him stand among them, and taking him in his arms, he said to them,
“Whoever*r welcomes*r one*r little*r child*r such*r as*r this*r in*r my*r name*r welcomes*r me.*r And*r whoever*r welcomes*r me*r does*r not*r welcome*r me,*r but*r him*r who*r sent*r me.”*r
In His Name
John*p said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone driving out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he wasn’t following us.”
“Don’t*rp stop*r him,”*r said Jesus, “because*r there*r is*r no*r one*r who*r will*r perform*r a*r miracle*r in*r my*r name*r who*r can*r soon*r afterward*r speak*r evil*r of*r me.*r
For*r whoever*r is*r not*r against*r us*r is*r for*r us.*r
And*r whoever*r gives*r you*r a*r cup*r of*r water*r to*r drink*r in*r my*r name,*r because*r you*r belong*r to*r Christ*r — truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r he*r will*r never*r lose*r his*r reward.*r
Warnings from Jesus

“But*rp whoever*r causes*r one*r of*r these*r little*r ones*r who*r believe*r in*r me*r to*r fall*r away*r — it*r would*r be*r better*r for*r him*r if*r a*r heavy*r millstone*r were*r hung*r around*r his*r neck*r and*r he*r were*r thrown*r into*r the*r sea.*r

“And*rp if*r your*r hand*r causes*r you*r to*r fall*r away,*r cut*r it*r off.*r It*r is*r better*r for*r you*r to*r enter*r life*r maimed*r than*r to*r have*r two*r hands*r and*r go*r to*r hell,*r the*r unquenchable*r fire.*r

And*r if*r your*r foot*r causes*r you*r to*r fall*r away,*r cut*r it*r off.*r It*r is*r better*r for*r you*r to*r enter*r life*r lame*r than*r to*r have*r two*r feet*r and*r be*r thrown*r into*r hell.*r

And*r if*r your*r eye*r causes*r you*r to*r fall*r away,*r gouge*r it*r out.*r It*r is*r better*r for*r you*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r with*r one*r eye*r than*r to*r have*r two*r eyes*r and*r be*r thrown*r into*r hell,*r
where*r their*ir worm*ir does*ir not*ir die,*ir and*ir the*ir fire*ir is*ir not*ir quenched.*ir
For*r everyone*r will*r be*r salted*r with*r fire.*r
Salt*r is*r good,*r but*r if*r the*r salt*r should*r lose*r its*r flavor,*r how*r can*r you*r season*r it?*r Have*r salt*r among*r yourselves,*r and*r be*r at*r peace*r with*r one*r another.”*r
